ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 3-5 hours/week.

I spent approximately three hours per week completing the readings. I spent about four hours on each homework assignment during the weeks that those were assigned. I spent much more time completing work for the class on the presentation and final.
4-5hr
On average, I spent about 4-5 hrs per week on the classwork. When individual assignments were due, I would obviously devote a bit more time.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Strengths: 1) thorough survey of hospital epidemiology 2) excellent expert speakers 3) useful homework assignmentsWeaknesses: 1) some redundancy in lecture material 2) language can get overly technical at times

Overall, I really enjoyed this class. I felt that the content flowed in a logic way and that the guest speakers were a valuable component of the class. It would have been nice to incorporate more of the readings from homework into class discussions or review by the instructor during class to reiterate the themes from the readings. I also would have enjoyed more small group in-class discussions because I think that served as a good forum for learning how to work through case studies. In the one situation where we did this, it worked very well. One other topic of the class that might serve as interesting to the students would be on how healthcare professionals deal with infection control in the third world. This would be interesting given that many students are interested in global health issues.
the lessons were well organized and the information was very comprehensive. the guest lecturers also brought an interesting perspective to the course.

I think that this was a great course. In particular, it was very important to be taught by an actual practitioner in the field. The readings were all relevant and useful. Even for items which made logical sense, the readings were still insightful.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Louise-Marie Dembry  Dr. Dembry was a great teacher both in and outside of the classroom. She went out of her way to make the class-room topics as interesting and relevant as possible.No weaknesses to report.

Instructor: Louise-Marie Dembry  I really enjoyed having this instructor this semester. Dr. Dembry was a very good lecturer and very amenable to structuring the class around the interests of the students. She graded fairly and required a reasonable amount of work from the students.
Instructor: Louise-Marie Dembry  The instructor was fantastic. She was incredibly versed and experienced in the subject.

Instructor: Louise-Marie Dembry  I think Dr. Dembry did a great job. Importantly, she was a no-nonsense professor in that if someone said something that was incorrect, she corrected them (nicely of course) such that the class would not suffer from misinformation. I think a lot of professors are hesitant to do that in fear of offending students, but it is of critical importance to the learning process.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Julie was a great TA: always eager to help, responsive to questions, and prompt.
Julie was approachable, helpful at answering questions, and served as a good TA for the class.
TA was good and very organized. She attended all lectures and was very quick to respond to emails and answer questions.
I think Julie also did a very good job. She was very accessible and willing to help.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This class covers a substantial amount of the hospital epidemiology literature. The work-load is reasonable and Dr. Dembry is a great lecturer.
Yes - I would recommend this course to fellow students with an interest in hospital epidemiology and/or infectious disease outbreaks in healthcare settings.
I would definitely recommend the course to others. It was challenging, but extremely rewarding and informative.
I would definitely recommend this course as an overview of the issue and topics that concern an institution-based epidemiologist.
